014package org.jdbi.v3.guice.internal;
015
016import java.util.Set;
017
018import javax.inject.Provider;
019import javax.inject.Singleton;
020import javax.sql.DataSource;
021
022import com.google.inject.Inject;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
024import org.jdbi.v3.guice.GuiceJdbiCustomizer;
025
026import static com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull;
027
028/**
029 * JDBI Factory creates a new {@link Jdbi} instance.
030 */
031@Singleton
032public final class InternalGuiceJdbiFactory implements Provider<Jdbi> {
033
034    private final DataSource dataSource;
035    // this is a set because it contains at least two customizers; one for the module and the global customizer (which may be a dummy).
036    private final Set<GuiceJdbiCustomizer> moduleCustomizers;
037
038    @Inject
039    InternalGuiceJdbiFactory(final DataSource dataSource,
040        @JdbiInternal final Set<GuiceJdbiCustomizer> moduleCustomizers) {
041        this.dataSource = checkNotNull(dataSource, "dataSource is null");
042        this.moduleCustomizers = checkNotNull(moduleCustomizers, "moduleCustomizers is null");
043    }
044
045    @Override
046    public Jdbi get() {
047        Jdbi jdbi = Jdbi.create(dataSource);
048        moduleCustomizers.forEach(c -> c.customize(jdbi));
049
050        return jdbi;
051    }
052}
